^31-MERICANS are the greatest "joiners” in the
world. We belong to 400,000 organizations,
covering every cause, every interest, every need
of our way of life.
In the past twenty years, business and profes¬
sional associations have multiplied faster than
either the population or the number of business
enterprises. With this expansion has come an
even greater need for trained executive leadership
of these organized groups.
Since 1920, when the American Society of
Association Executives was formed, the manage¬
ment of voluntary groups, especially those of
business, industry and the professions, has de¬
veloped and kept pace with the tremendous
growth. The Society's membership has grown
from the original twenty-two founders to its
present strength of nearly 2,500 members.
It is no longer possible for the untrained,
unskilled person to manage an association suc¬
cessfully. There are too many problems, too
many opportunities for failure — and failure
within an association can bring disaster to an
entire industry. ASAE provides the professional
association executive with the means to turn
possible failure into success.
